section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-b562c9a elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section
elementor-element elementor-element-a07f510 elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-inner-section

h3.strong: Do You Need To Speak With A School Counselor or Social Worker?

div.strong: With schools being closed for students due to COVID-19, our ACS School Counselors and Social Worker are available to meet virtually or by phone. By clicking the link below, students are able to complete a form to schedule a meeting. After receiving the form, a School Counselor or the Social Worker will email the student with an appointment time.

strong.i: “Disclaimer” This form should be used to schedule sessions during regular school
This form will be checked by the school counselors or social worker during regular school hours. This service is only for non-emergencies.
If you are experiencing a medical/mental health emergency, please contact 911 or Integrated Family Services at

b.u: Please use this link to set up a meeting with an ACS School Counselor or Social Worker

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-4fa6fb7 elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section
elementor-element elementor-element-054944e elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-inner-section

div.h3: Feed Your Stomach, Feed Your Mind

p.strong: In addition to our scheduled meal delivery, the ACS school bus will also serve as a Book Mobile on Wednesdays bringing boxes of books to both elementary and middle/high school students.

You can even check the online library and reserve your book through OPAC or by emailing Mrs. Prescott at library@arapahoecharter.org. And you can return your books at the Book Mobile on Wednesdays as well.
It gets better! Books can also be checked out on Fridays at the school and don’t forget – there’s a lot of online reading resources, especially for our high school students.

div.h2:
Get on your marks,
Get set,
READ!

div.h3: It’s Time To Order Your Yearbook!

p.strong: This has been a very unique school year, and it will make for a very unique Yearbook, so be sure to order yours soon!
Follow this link to the site where you can order your 2019-2020 Yearbook.

p.strong: The regularly scheduled Arapahoe Charter School Board of Director’s Meeting of March 26 at 6:00 p.m. has been canceled.

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-0e80c78 elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section
elementor-element elementor-element-482bb94 elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-inner-section

div.p: If you indicated that you are in need of meal service you can pick up grab & go breakfast and lunch meals from the location nearest to you. Please call the school if you have any questions or would like to request meal service. Meals are available for all children in your household ages birth through 18.

p.strong: Distribution days:
Distribution sites are as follows:

p.span: 11:00 a.m. – 3:00 p.m. (please go to the door by the cafeteria)

p.b: Temple Baptist Church in New Bern

p.span: 12:15 – 12:45 p.m. (Revised due to the change in the Ferry schedule.)

div.p: If you did not tell one of our callers that you need meals, please call our main office at 252-249-2599 to let us know.

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-7eb546c elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section
elementor-element elementor-element-afff255 elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-inner-section

div.h3: Our ACS leadership, under the direction of Gov. Roy Cooper, is taking steps to protect our families and entire community regarding the spread of COVID-19.

h3.br: With multiple confirmed cases in our state, all schools will be closed beginning Monday, March 16, for the next two weeks. Going forward, we are preparing to provide online instruction and will soon provide further details prior to the start of lessons.
We pray that all our Bobcat family members stay safe and healthy during this time.
We will continue to keep our ACS families informed on a day-to-day basis of the latest information affecting our student body.
Please share this information so everyone knows.

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-08b809c elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.h2: Apply Now for the 2020-2021 School Year!

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-333bf59 elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-inner-section

div.class: elementor-element elementor-element-53e4519 elementor-arrows-position-inside elementor-pagination-position-outside elementor-widget elementor-widget-image-carousel

div.h3: Put Your Child In The Picture To Succeed

p.strong: Arapahoe Charter School is now accepting applications for the 2020 – 2021 school year in grades K through 9.

div.p: Since our opening in 1997 we have recognized that each child is uniquely different and may, at times, need special instruction and attention. We strive to meet the needs of our diverse community, sparking the learning desires of “below average students” at risk of giving up on learning, challenging “average students” to do their very best, and motivating “above average students” to rise to their full potential.

strong.a: Apply online now for the 2020-2021 school year

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-1d8c1d9 elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section
elementor-element elementor-element-bde8ec0 elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-inner-section

h3.strong: We know the Coronavirus Virus is on everyone’s mind.

p.strong: Each day we are learning more about this virus especially through reputable websites such as NCDHHS.gov.
Know that we are taking every precaution possible – we know you are as well. As a reminder, consider the following recommendations below to keep our students as safe as possible.

li.strong: Stay home when sick. Your child should be free from fever, vomiting, and diarrhea for 24 hours without the use of medication before returning to school. A temperature is a fever when it is greater than 100 degrees.
Wash hands often with warm water and soap for 20 seconds. Alternatively, use hand sanitizers with 60%-90% alcohol for 20 seconds if soap and water is unavailable.
Cover coughs and sneezes with tissues or your elbow and then wash hands.
Avoid touching your mouth, nose or eyes with unwashed hands.
Disinfect commonly touched surfaces with household disinfectant, following label instructions.
And please remember – this isn’t a time to panic, it’s a time to take precautions.

p.strong: Thank you for your support and partnership as we work together
to maintain a healthy learning environment.

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-d23dc18 elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section
elementor-element elementor-element-425e56f elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-inner-section

div.h3: Calendar revised: March 12 will be a full day
div.p: To help make up the day lost due to weather, Arapahoe Charter School will be open a full day on March 12 (not the half day originally scheduled). March 13 remains a teacher workday (no school for students).
Here is a link to the revised calendar.

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-6df4784 elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-top-section
elementor-element elementor-element-987418e elementor-section-boxed elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-height-default elementor-section elementor-inner-section

br.strong: Elephants, Tigers, and Books, Oh My!

p.span: Arapahoe Charter School will host a Scholastic Book Fair Thursday, March 5, through Thursday, March 12, from 8:00 AM to 3:30 PM in the Media Center; the fair will be open on Friday, March 13 from 8:00-10:00 AM. Books and supplies will be purchased for the Media Center from the Book Fair profit. Families, teachers, and the community are invited to attend the Book Fair, featuring the theme,

i.span: Book Fair Jungle- Elephants, Tigers, and Books, Oh My!

p.strong: Tuesday, March 10, from 5:00 to 7:30 PM, the Book Fair will feature a special Family Night to coincide with the Title 1 STEM Night.

p.span: The Book Fair is open to the community.

Book Fair customers may help the school build classroom libraries and improve children’s reading skills by purchasing books through the Classroom Teacher Wish List and One for Books programs. Gift certificates are also available but must be used during the current book fair.
We gladly accept cash, check, or credit card.

b.i: Student eWallets are available for this fair; shoppers can set up and manage funds between February 24 through March 13.

p.span: Our online fair will run from March 4 through March 17, and all purchases will be shipped to your home address.
The online fair can be accessed at
or through the Scholastic Book Fairs app.
For more information about the Book Fair, contact Sandi Prescott at 252-249-2599 ext. 1103.

p.strong: Monday, March 2

div.p: Crazy Hat Day to celebrate Dr. Seuss’s birthday

p.strong: Tuesday, March 3

div.p: Animal Print Day to celebrate the book If I Ran The Zoo

p.strong: Wednesday, March 4

div.p: Crazy Socks Day to celebrate the book Fox In Socks
Oh, The Places You’ll Go Day to celebrate the book Oh, The Places You’ll Go! Wear college T-shirts to support the school you hope to go to, or dress for a career you hope to have in the future.

p.strong: Friday, March 6

div.p: Dr. Seuss Spirit Day Dress as your favorite Dr. Seuss character

p.strong: Poster Contest

ul.li: Create a poster celebrating Dr. Seuss (favorite books or characters)

Turn it in to the main office
by February 28
Put your name on the BACK! If your name is on the front it will NOT be judged.
Posters may or may not be returned.
